choices: in a rural area, close to a farm
1.content:
You slowly open your eyes and stare at the sky. Lying on your back, you feel somehow strange and very exhausted but you dont’ know why. Your head hurts and your legs feel like if you’ve taken part in a marathon a couple of hours ago.
Finally, you try to get on your feet and think about your situation: “Where am I? What time is it? What happened to me.... and why the hell do I have to ask questions like that?”
As you finally manage to stand up and open your eyes completely, you immediately fall down again due to what you just witness.
The world around you is gigantic! Somehow you must have shrunk. This new awareness complicates the question of what happened to you even more.
“Impossible....”, you think. “This has to be a weird dream.... a hallucination or whatever!”
but suddenly, some scenes from several hours ago come to your mind!
You remember who you are and where you were when you suddenly lost consciousness.
To be precise, you are...
1.title: Waking up

11.content:
You try to remember yesterday's events:
It seems like you were on a camping-tour when suddenly you lost consciousness and collapsed beneath a tree.
Absolutely great.... your equipment is gone, you have no idea where you are and something let you shrunk while you were unconscious.

By the way: how "big" are you now?
11.title: Your size

choices: North where you see some old ruins
111.content:
Thinking over your situation carefully, you decide that the best thing to do is finding a path or a street and look for help.
So, equipped with nothing but a few clothes, your walking-shoes and your jacket, you prepare for a long walk.
The problem still is: you don't know your exact location and you don't recognize this place so you can't figure out the right direction.

It's up to you. Where would you like to go?
111.title: Time to go.... but which direction?

choices: Nothing - you are interrupted by a loud noise
1111.content:
You decide for the direction with less trees and more significant places.... maybe you'll recognize the ruins from somewhere.
Proceeding is not quite easy for someone with your size. High grass disturbs your view and obstacles like rocks and branches block your way.

Nevertheless, you make it safely across a hill and after what seems like an hour, you arrive at an old stonewall. With disappointment, you notice that this place is absolutely not familiar to you. There's just a few old walls, a small, ancient tower and an abandoned stone building.
"Damn!" you think and try to climb on a large rock to get a better overview of your surrounding area. Fortunately, you spot a small path leading away from the ruins.
You could try to follow this path or you could check the ruins and the old building for something helpful.

What will it be?
1111.title: The ruins

choices: Go check it out, you'll feel safer when you know what it is.
11111.content:
You want to get out of there as quickly as possible so you decide to take the path. Sooner or later it will take you to a place where you can find help... at least you hope so.
Even at your size, it is quite easy to follow the path due to the fact that there are no more obstacles in your way, so you proceed faster than you thought you would.
After some time, you have the strange feeling of being observed by someone or something. You try to proceed even faster but as you suddenly hear the breaking of branches from somewhere beyond the path, you instantly stand still.
Is there something following you or was it just a coincident... maybe the wind?
11111.title: Following the path

choices: It does,   in a way you won't like.
Maybe it does but it follows it's primary target.
111111.content:
Stading absolutely still, you can hear unidentifiable noises nearby but they do not really sound dangerous... probably some deer or something else that just moved too close to the path.
To calm yourself down, you want to be absolutely sure that it really is nothing that follows you and even if it was... would it help you to run away at your size?
So you carefully go to the edge of the path and seek cover behind a rather small tree.
Slowly moving around the tree, you gaze at a nearby clearing from where you think you heard the noises some seconds ago.
Now you see and hear absolutely nothing and just as you begin to calm down a little bit, there is a cracking sound directly behind you.
You instantly turn around and by the sight of the large grey wolf now standing in front of you, you almost get a heart attack.
The wolf was probably hunting for something else, maybe it was also attrackted by the sounds coming from the clearing but now it has spotted you.
The question is: Does it find you interesting or not.......?
111111.title: Curiosity killed the cat..... and also you?

1111111.content:
Whatever was there on the clearing is long gone so the wolf is now fixed on you.
It lowers it's head and sniffs at you while you just stand there, unable to move.
Finally, when it's muzzle is so close to you that you can feel it's breath, you slip out of your paralysis.
You scream and try to run backwards but you fall over your own feet and find yourself lying backwards on the ground. Now, also the wolf decides to make its move. It opens its maw and grabs you by the legs - not hurting you but lifting you up in the air.
Dangling from ithe wolfs maw, you try to get free of it's grip but with no sign of success. The wolf just lays its head back and opens its jaws a bit so you slide completely into the maw which it immediately closes around you.
Now beeing surrounded by darkness, you feel the wolfs wet tongue beneath you
while it consideres your taste and obviously likes it.
Seconds later, you feel a huge preasure as the wolf swallows you and its throat-muscles work on you from all sides. You slide down to its stomach where you keep kicking and struggeling.
On the outside, the wolf licks its lips and continues the hunt. You did not make a very big prey but since its primary target got away, you were better than nothing.
After several minutes, you lose consciousness and fall asleep. The wolf meanwhile grows tired of hunting. It settles down beneath a big tree and slowly digests you.
1111111.title: Wolf food

choices: You rest until you feet don't hurt anymore and continue your march
You are pretty exhausted and fall asleep immediately
111112.content:
This is the first time that you are totally aware of the fact that you are very very small and the world and also it's inhabitants around you are veeeery big....
Now getting the feeling that something might be following you, you break out in panic and start to run as fast as you can. You do not even look back and after some minutes, you are totally exhausted and have to take a break.
With great relief, you notice that nothing was following you and you lay down on the grass at the side of the path.
Your feet feel like they won't carry you any longer so you consider the possibility of resting for a while.
111112.title: Run - run and don't look back!

1111121.content:
You really feel like your body could use some rest but the idea of going to sleep in the middle of nowhere under these circumstances seems rather stupid to you and so you force yourself to hit the road again.
The whole thing is not getting easier at all... even though you are following a visible path, there are lots of small holes, stones and puddles that block your way from time to time.
After what seems like hours of walking to you, you finally notice that you must be on the right way. To your right, there is a small (not small for you of course) stonewall, probably surrounding a field of grass and there is also a small bench. These slight indications of civilisation give you new hope and you follow the path alongside the stonewall.
The way to the corner of the field is uneventful and now, there is a sharp right-turn. You can not see anything yet because the wall blocks your sight but you presume that the path will probably lead you around the field. You beg that there will not be another endless dirty path ahead of you so you cross your fingers and walk around the corner.
Behind the corner, you face....
1111121.title: puddles and stones...

11111211.content:
You get a huge shock as you check out what is beyond the corner because the first thing you see is a large red fox sneaking through the grass next to the wall.
In fact, you've never seen a wild fox before but it kind of looks like you imagined it: Red-Orange and white fur, a big, bushy tail and big ears... well and these ears help it to locate its prey and you can count yourself quite unlucky to run straight into a wild fox on the hunt.
As the fox spots you, it immediately dashes forward from the grass and heads for you. You are sure of the fact that it probably considers you as its next meal so you desperately try to elude the incoming predator and run away.
You know that it would take a miracle to save you now but everything makes more sense than just standing still.
No miracle happens... running away does not help you and the fox quickly catches you and takes you into its maw. You see the sharp teeth around you and feel the fox's tongue moving over your body. Of course, the fox did never have the chance to taste a human before so it takes some time to analyze your flavour. Coming to the decision that something that delicious would make an excellent meal, the fox finally finishes the act and ends your struggles by swallowing you whole. Feeling you sliding down its throat, it licks its lips pleasurably and walks away.
You're still awake inside the fox's stomach and squirm around, knowing that there is no escape from this hot, moist prison. Due to the fact that there's not much oxygen surrounding you, you lose consciousness after some minutes.
Your body is slowly worked through the fox's intestines and finally, at the end of the day, the fox has completely digested you and made good use of your body.
Bad luck indeed but after all, you did something good by providing this beautiful animal with valuable nutrients.
11111211.title: Bad luck

choices: Turn araound and walk away slowly
11111212.content:
Right in front of you, there is a big, wild looking dog. It has long, white and black fur and to you it looks like a Husky but you can't tell for sure. On the one hand, this is a quite positive sign because it probably belongs to someone nearby... maybe to a farmer who owns the big field but on the other hand you feel a little uncomfortable, facing such a big creature at your size.
However, the dog seems to be busy, sniffing at something lying in the high grass but as you walk around the corner, it pauses for a second.... and so do you.
You freeze abruptly and examine the gigantic animal in front of you.
It does not lift its head but it looks at you with obvious curiosity and you wonder weather it is more interested in the thing lying in the grass... or in you.
What will you do?
11111212.title: Well hello.......

choices: It would be safer to camp.
111112121.content:
You stand stock-still, tightening every muscle in your body. You hope as hard as you can, and even pray, that the dog does not see you. It seems like an eternity, the dog just standing there, staring at you. You can feel the dogs warm breath, every exhale like a clock ticking to your doom.

         Then it decides that you are of no interest to it, and the dog trots over to the lying body in the grass. As soon as you leave the dog's line of sight, you slip right up against the stone wall, your back facing it. Then, the dog runs across your vision, taking no further notice of you. You see in its mouth what looks to be a rabbit. What a close call!

         As you relish in the fact that your body is still, in fact, in one piece, you notice something that begins to worry you. The sun is setting, and it won't be long until a cold, dark night will arrive. You look are tasty prey even to the animals in the day, but the night-dwellers would relish a feast as grand as you. Being out in the unsheltered night is as good as suicide.

         Two options present themselves: Try and follow the dog, and see where it lives, or find a safe place to camp for the night.
111112121.title: Stand still

1111121211.content:
You Realize that the dog must live somewhere. So, you begin in the direction you saw the dog going. The path ends, and you push your way through the long grass, and you begin to climb over a hill. The sun begins to set, and the world is plunged into a twilight.

         Eventually, after several hours of climbing, you crest over the hill, and you notice a farmhouse! Right, you think, I can camp there for the night!

         What you don't notice is the shadow moving approaching you from behind...

         The falcon lands right behind you! You run, but the falcon grabs you in it's beak! You struggle, but as it's shaking you, you are in so much agonizing pain that you cant struggle any more. The falcon swallows you whole. It's a good thing you got knocked out during the struggle, so you don't have to feel the falcon's digestive system doing it's job.
1111121211.title: That dog must live somewhere!

choices: Go looking for a hole to camp in.
Cover yourself with leaves and sleep.
1111121212.content:
The best thing to do, you think to yourself, is to find a place to camp for the night. Wherever the dog went would be to far away, and the important part of that is that the dog will still be there when I arrive.

         You decide to scout out a suitable place to stay for the night. You think that the safest home would be a hole, covered in sticks, and then in leaves. However, you don't really have time to do something on that scale. The best you can hope for are some leaves covering you to provide a hidden shelter. You head to the nearest forest, thinking of what do to when you get there as well as what to do after that. So, what should you do?
1111121212.title: Going Camping

11111212122.content:
Once you get to the nearby forest, you look around for some leaves to sleep in. After a while, and with very little sunlight left, you find a nice spot under a tree. After you gather some leaves to act as a blanket (and camouflage), you lie under them and, because of how worn-out you are, quickly fall asleep.

         You dream about a land where everything is made out of cheese, and then you are in a bus, and your teeth fall out. And then there is cake, and it tastes good.

         And you are right in the middle of a dream about igneous rock statues when you suddenly awake to-
11111212122.title: Sleeping under the stars

choices: A beetle with red and green spots.
111112121221.content:
You are jolted out of a sound sleep by a noise! It sounds very much like an animal, and sure enough, you see a big, brown bear, only about 10 feet away! The bear takes no notice of you, instead searching for sustenance on the foliage.

         Unable to find anything in the bushes, the bear wanders off. You begin to relax, and you examine your surroundings. The time is just after dawn, there is dew on all the plants, the sun is shining, the birds are singing, and you feel as if you're about to die of starvation. You push the now wet leaves off you, stretch your limbs, and begin to walk.

         You head to a nearby plant, and suck some of the dew off it. That solves your thirst, but there still is the problem of food. You know that there must be some kind of edible bug somewhere around here, and you begin to hunt. After a while of searching, you find:
111112121221.title: Close Call

1111121212212.content:
After a while of unsuccessful hunting, and just when you think you will give up, you notice a small beetle with red and green spots nearby. It is about an inch long, and is calmly munching on some leaves. You approach it, and in one fluid motion, tackle it. The bug begins to squirm, and as you try to kill it, it secretes a green liquid all over you!

         You loose grip on the beetle, and you start to feel funny...

         Oh! You know what you need to do! How could you have not known this? Kill the dragon, then loot the dungeon! Easy as PI!

         While you are content in your own little world, the beetle begins to devour you, starting with your head.
1111121212212.title: Hallucinations

111112121222.content:
You wake up around mid-morning with a jolt, and look around very quickly to see a rock tumble by, and another and another and...

         Oh no! you think to yourself. A rock-slide! You begin dodging rocks, but as time goes on they increase in number! You begin to run, but it is no use! You get smacked by a rock, and it sends you flying, tearing your arm right off! A shower of blood coats some nearby rocks, trees, and an unlucky bird that just happened to be perched on a branch nearby.

         "AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHOHGODOHGODAHHHHGGU!" You hear, and you realize that the voice you hear is none other but your own. You continue to scream as you land, but as the dirt flows over you and the earth swallows you whole, it doesn't do you any good. In a few years, what's left of your remains will help fertilize a small section of the forest.
111112121222.title: Rock-slide!

111112122.content:
Your move too suddenly. Now, you've got the dogs full attention. In one swift movement it takes you in its mouth. You smell the animals awful breath, a disturbing prelude of things to come. It tosses you back into its throat and swallows. You make a brief impression in the dogs throat in the seconds it takes you to reach its stomach.

You land in a pool of meaty soup. The smell is worse than you could've imagined. Although it was still in the middle of digesting a previous meal the dogs stomach was delighted at the addition of you, and responded with more acids and redoubled churnings.

With a full belly, the dog lost interest in whatever she had caught, and returns home to her master.

"Hey there girl," you hear a girls voice through the walls of the dogs stomach. "You catch more of those thieving rabbits."

You cry out, but the girl thinks your cries are just the sound of indigestion. She rubs the dogs belly, and you push back as a desparate attempt to let her know that you're alive in her dogs stomach.

She feels your movements and says, "wow, this one must of been small, it's still alive in there," and with an evil smile she says, "let that pest squirm." And she leaves to dog to digest her meal.

The next day you're just another pile of natural furtaliser.
111112122.title: Turn araound and walk away slowly

11113.content:
A loud screech breaks the silence and you instinctively flinch and look around carefully. You see a bird flying down from one of the trees surrounding the ruins... "a pretty big bird", you notice on a second look and finally, you recognize the animal as a falcon.
Still standing on the rock on which you climbed before (what makes you an easy target by the way), you watch the falcon approaching and too late you notice that it is heading straight for you!
Shocked by this new and frightening fact, you try to jump off the rock but it is a matter of fact that falcons are fast. Very fast. Seconds later, you find yourself in the birds talons, ascending high into the air. Panic overcomes you and you don't know what to do... if you struggle against the falcons grip and it drops you, you are doomed for sure and if you just hold still and do nothing, you'll probably end up as food for the great bird.
In fact, there is nothing you can do at all. Your flight is over again after a few seconds as the falcon heads for the old tower to land on its top.
Shortly before it lands, it abruptly releases you and you hit the ground. Feeling dizzy from the flight and the impact, you try to get on your feet as quickly as possible but of course, the falcon did not lose its interest in you.
Once again, you are knocked off your feet as it takes you into its sharp beak and lifts you up in the air.
Now being in the birds beak with your feet still hanging out, you totally panic and start kicking and screaming. It does not help you at all. The falcon tips its head back a couple of times to bring you entirely into its beak and then, with a quick gulp, it swallows you whole and alive.
You quickly slide down its throat and land in its stomach where you keep on struggeling, not willing to accept your fate. Your screams are heard through the birds feathers but of course there is no one to hear them but the falcon itself.
You are completely exhausted, your head is spinning and after some time, you pass out.

The falcon meanwhile has left the tower again and flies back to the forest. While digesting you, it returns to its favourite tree to wait for the next careless prey.
11113.title: Caught by the falcon

choices: Finally, with great effort, you get there.
Before you get there, you encounter something...
1112.content:
You don't remember any of those strange old ruins to the north so it is more likely that your way back leads to the other direction.
However, being just 3 inches tall and moving around in a forest is everything but easy. You proceed very slowly and its hard for you to see anything in the distance.
Luckily, after one hour of walking and climbing, you see a lake, roughly 100-200 meters away from your location and you decide to go there.
Hoping that you will recognize that place or, in the best case, even find help there, you start moving.
1112.title: Moving southwards

11122.content:
After about 15 minutes of walking, you reach a small river. Following it will certainly lead you to the lake and in addition, you'll make sure not to lose your way in the brush-wood of the forest.
So you continue your march and soon, the river is getting wider and you notice several reed plants... the lake is near.
Suddenly, you hear something rustling and you notice a movement behind you.
You instinctively seek cover behind a small stone and try to spot the source of the noise.

The animal that was behind you and now slowly approaches your hiding place is...
11122.title: Following the river

choices: Jump up and run for it!
111221.content:
You stay calm behind your stone and watch how the big bird slowly walks towards your position. It has a pretty elegant shape: Thick grey and white feathers, long legs, a long curved neck, a really big beak and a pair of yellow eyes that scan the surrounding area... probably for a nice breakfast.
Taking a few more steps, the heron casually pecks up a small insect and swallows it instantly. You are not sure weather it has noticed you yet but if it does, you are almost sure that the same thing might happen to you, so you crouch behind your cover, hold your breath and hope desperately that the heron will just pass by.
It does not. You hear it taking 2 more steps, then it pauses directly behind you. Looking up, you stare directly into it's eyes as it is now towering above you.
It has seen you, no doubt about that... so what will your reaction be?
111221.title: Elegant hunter

choices: Follow the river... keeping a safe distance.
1112211.content:
"What would it help to run?" you think by yourself. Well, even if you wanted to flee, you are not even sure if your legs would carry you right now for you are totally paralyzed with fear. You close your eyes and expect the worst to happen.

A quick motion... a slight airdraft .... and a splashing sound. The heron jumped right over you and landed in the river. This must be your lucky day. It has probably spotted something more interesting than you, maybe a big fish.

You sit on the ground for 1 or 2 minutes to calm yourself down before getting on your feet again to continue your way. This little event clearly showed you that you have to find some help and a safer place as quickly as possible. However, you surely don't want to go any further through this tricky area so you move towards the forest again.

Would you now like to follow the river out of harm's way at the forest's edge or do you feel even safer within the forest?
1112211.title: Lucky this time....

11122112.content:
You decide that the safest thing to do is to return to the forest. There is no sense in being eaten by another heron, or being devoured by goose, or being eviscerated by killer carp, or god knows what else!

         So, you begin the journey back to the forest. You journey for another half-hour, carefully stepping over sticks and stones back up the way you came. You slip on some wet leaves, and bruise your arm. You are sitting on the dirt, catching your breath, when you begin to notice that the sun is setting. Traveling in the sunlight at this size is dangerous, but in the dark it's outright suicide! You should find a place to sleep for tonight, and get help tomorrow. That's the smart choice. But, your stomach growls even as you think. Should you go out and look for food, or make a camp somewhere?
11122112.title: Back to the forest.

1112212.content:
Seems like you waited too long in your hiding-place... either the heron knew you were there or it has just found you by coincidence but the fact is: It has now spotted you!
You react immediately by quickly jumping up and dashing away towards the lake.
Wow... you are even faster than you thought you'd ever be! However, it is not fast enough.
You can not tell for sure if the heron was really after you but now that you are running away, the fast motions surely attrackt its attention. The bird does not even have to perform a complete step to catch up with you. It pecks you up with a well placed strike and holds you in the front of its beak.
It is not quite as painful as it might look like and you are not hurt but now, the feeling of being caught overwhelms you and you start kicking and squirming to get out of its grip.
The heron is used to this behavier of a freshly caught prey and it has some methods to handle you. Normally, herons catch fishes or other animals that are much bigger than you and tranquilize them by eigher impaling them with their beak or shaking them for a while until they are exhausted.
This is exactly what the heron that has just caught you is now doing. It quickly moves its head up and down and from side to side. After some seconds, you feel dizzy and a little bit sick what causes you to stop moving and instead gasping for air with your head and feet hanging out at both sides of the birds long beak while you look up in the air.
This should be the last time that you see the sky... the heron tilts its head back in a quick motion and you land directly in its throat, being gulped down right on the spot.
There is a small bulge of you seen in the herons neck, quickly moving down and finally disappearing into its belly.

The heron is quite content with its catch. You were a nice-sized appetizer for it and so, it proceeds, trying to find something else to add to its breakfast.
1112212.title: Heron's lunch

choices: Dive into the hole, hoping that it’s unoccupied
Carry on running away from the otter
111222.content: You turn around to face a house-sized otter staring directly down at you, its eyes locked on you. The otter licks its maw and takes a step towards you. You turn around and run as fast as you possibly can, hoping to find somewhere you can take shelter away from the otter. Adrenaline is pumped through your body as you can feel the warm breath of the otter as it trails you as you frantically run to get away. Just as your legs begin to tire, you notice a small burrow hole to your right, near to a large tree. The hole appears to be large enough to accommodate you, and small enough to stop the otter from reaching you. However, there’s no guarantee that the hole is empty. Who’s to say that there is not another animal inside that would equally view you as a quick snack? At this point though, your options are limited, with the otter right behind you, you have to make a decision fast. You:
111222.title: Chased by otter

1112221.content:
You dive into the hole, barely avoiding the otter's huge jaws as they snap shut behind you. You back up deeper into the hole, trying to avoid the otter's paws reaching in to grab you. You stand far back, but start to hear noises behind you. Turning around, you see a big rabbit standing there, staring at you. It's not moving at all, and you can't tell if it's because it's trying to figure out what you are or because it's so scared of the otter attacking its home that it can't move.

You glance back at the entrance of the hole, and see the otter still is groping for you with one of its front paws. If it grabbed you, who knows what it would do to you? But if you stay here, that rabbit could also have its way with you...

The question is, which one do you take your chances with?
1112221.title: Dive into the hole, hoping that it’s unoccupied

choices: The rabbit lunges aggressively! It doesn't like you staying in its home!
The rabbit doesn't attack you, letting you remain in its home for now
11122211.content:
Otters are carnivores and rabbits are herbivores. At least, you think that's the case. If that's true, then staying with this rabbit will probably be safer than going towards the otter. So, you take a few cautious steps towards the rabbit, glancing back at the otter's huge paw still reaching for you. The rabbit still doesn't react, and seems to be too afraid of the otter to do anything about your approach. That's lucky, since it seems to be several times your size, and could easily hurt you if it got threatened by you.

Soon, the otter seems to give up, and removes its paw from the rabbit's tunnel. You can see it turn and leave, heading for the nearby river and diving in. With a sigh of relief, you turn back towards the rabbit. With the threat of the otter passed, it can now turn it's attention to you, and it's time to see if your choice to stay with it was the right one...
11122211.title: The rabbit

111222111.content:
The rabbit growled, she didn't you in her home. You back up in fear, when the rabbit lunged!! You grunt at the rodent's weight, but this was soon the least of your worries when the rabbit opened her maw, wanting you to gurgle!!

Before you could act, she shoved you into her maw, sucking and tossing you about. She really loved your taste, but decided to gulp her down. And gulp she did, your sorry form sliding down her throat and landing with a splash in her stomach.

Full and happy, the rabbit lay back down sleeping her meal off. Midday she awoke, looking with pride at her fattened rump, before venturing further into her burrow.
111222111.title: The rabbit lunges aggressively! It doesn't ...

111222112.content: The rabbit surprisingly doesn’t mind you staying inside of it’s burrow. In fact, it almost invites you in. It stands up a bit, giving you a gap under it to crawl past. You cannot see how deep the burrow goes. It seems to go on forever. The rabbit looks at you expectantly, wanting you to go past it and deeper into it’s home. Do you?
111222112.title: The rabbit doesn't attack you, letting you ...

1112221121.content:
You crawl farther into the rabbit's burrow, the animal laying back down, closing off the entrance. Well, no going back now. You quickly find out the burrow is utterly massive, at least to you in your current size.

You just wander aimlessly, not sure were to go. Suddenly you hear a snuffling noise coming from one of the burrows.

You look and come face to face with...
1112221121.title: Yes

choices: It thinks you taste good! (oh no!)
11122212.content:
You decide to let the otter have you. Hopefully it won't think you seem tasty. But you know they eat meat, and that worries you, but that rabbit looks like it wouldn't like you staying in its home. You decide you're in trouble either way, so you start walking towards the otter's paw.

As it reaches for you, it touches you, and the otter finally finds where you are. The paw raises up and slams down, trying to pin you, but it misses. You run forward, past it, trying to get into the otter's view. As you start to leave the hole, you finally can see the otter again, and it notices you. It makes a short barking noise, and pulls its paw out of the hole. It cocks its head to the side, as if it's wondering why you would come out into the open instead of hiding.

You raise your arms to your sides, and shout for it to grab you or leave. At this point, you've given up hope of surviving unless some sort of miracle happens, so you just stand there expecting the otter to snatch you up.

After a few moments of staring down at you, it does. Raising its left paw, it quickly reaches for you, it digits spreading and very tightly wrapping around your tiny body from chest down. You gasp and grunt as the otter's grip tightens, and you're picked up off the ground. The otter raises you to its face, which looks cute ordinarily but now looks frightening. The otter sniffs at you a bit, thengives your face a slow lick. You cough and wipe your face with your free arms, and the otter seems to consider your taste...
11122212.title: In the otter's grasp

111222121.content:
The otter licked its lips, hunger in its brown eyes. Your heart plummets at the sight, and you start kicking wildly.

The otter merely sticks its tongue out again, slowly dragging it across your face, purring with delight at your pathetic attempts to get free.

You look on in horror when the otter slowly opened its maw, and try to sock the mammal in the muzzle, but to no avail.

The otter shoved you into its gob, snapping its jaws shut afterward. You gag at the fishy smell as the otter's tongue curled around your tender body, pressing you it the roof of its mouth, and sucking on your body, purring at your taste.

After a moment, the otter tilted its head back and swallowed you, pawing playfully at the bulge in its neck. You plop into its belly, which reeked of rotten fish. A few moments later, the stomach acids started flowing, burning you, making you cry out in pain as you were melted alive. The otter curled up on the ground, napping. A few minutes later all that remained of you was a wee bit of pudge on the otter's backside.
111222121.title: It thinks you taste good! (oh no!)

choices: The otter nuzzles you and hurries off with you in its grasp; you're its pet!
The otter growls and drops you, leaving you alone to go free
111222122.content: The otter coughs and gags slightly, glaring st you as if its your own fault you taste so bad. You don't feel insulted, though, because that means you won't die a horrible death in its stomach. However, as the otter looks at the tiny human held in its paw, it begins to wonder if it should let such a strange creature go. It's never seen anything like you, and it almost feels like it wants to keep you as a curiosity....
111222122.title: It thinks you taste bad (whew)

choices: It jumps in, and you go underwater
It turns away from the river, running along the side
1112221221.content:
The otter moves you to its snout, making you worried it changed its mind about not eating you, but it simpky nuzzles you. You're confused by that, but realize the otter is showing you it means you no harm. However. That might not be such a good thing, as you're currently in its grasp, completely helpless. It can do whatever it wants with you--and that worries you even more than if it was about to eat you.

The otter,movingon three legs with the fourth's paw holding you close to its body, hurries along, moving towards the river. You suddenly realize it's about to jump in--if it does, and keeps holding you, you won't be able to breathe!
1112221221.title: You're its pet!

choices: The otter rolls onto its back and floats, getting you out of the water
The otter keeps swimming, holding you underwater
11122212211.content:
Theotter jumps into the water, and you barely have time to take a deep breath before you're underwater. The impact hurts,almost knocking the air out of you, but you manage to hold your breath. You try opening your eyes, but you can only see the otter's chest. You can tell the otter is swimming quickly, and unfortunately doesn't seem to realize the tiny human in its grasp needs air to survive.

As you slowly start running out of air...
11122212211.title: It jumps in, and you go underwater

111222122112.content:
The otter doesn't let go of you, and it doesn't lift you out of the water for air. You're struggling to hold your breath, and start squirming and hitting the otter's paw as much as possible, but to no avail. However, you notice you're starting to slip out of its grip--perhaps the speed it's swimming is making you slide, along with the chance it's not focusing on keeping a firm hold on you, instead focusing on swimming safely through the river.

You keep squirming, hoping you can get out...
111222122112.title: The otter keeps swimming, holding you underwater

choices: You make it safely, and continue on your way
1112221221122.content:
Suddenly, you feel yourself slip out of the otter's paw. You're free! But you're also almost out of air, and you start struggling to get to the surface. Somehow, you manage to make it, just as you start feeling yourself blacking iut. You take some deep breaths, and see a dark shale underwater that you assume to be the otter quickly moving downriver. It hasn't noticed you got away--and that makes you happy.

What makes you sad is how you're still tiny. And also currently in the middle of a wide river. With a sigh, you start swimming to the edge, hoping nothing decides to attack you....
1112221221122.title: You survive

11122212211221.content: You feel something wrap around your body. You get scared and start to struggle, thinking that you were about to die. But then you see a cute little otter nose poke out of the water this is followed by a whole head. The otter had come back for you and has you back in it’s firm grasp. It starts to swim again. But does it learn it’s lesson from last time?
11122212211221.title: Something attacks! Oh no!

1112222.content: You decide that it would be too risky to go into the hole. At your size anything that may be residing in the hole would likely view you as food. Even though you are running as fast as you can, the thud of the otter’s feet pounding in your ears grows louder and you feel the warm breath of the gargantuan monster on the back of your neck getting hotter as the otter draws closer. Your legs are getting tired, yet the otter, used to chasing down small prey such as yourself, gains speed as it gets ready to snatch you up in its mouth. You get a cramp, forcing you to slow down. The otter seizes this opportunity and lowers its head down towards you, opens its huge jaws and encloses you within its cavernous mouth. You find yourself lying face down on the otter’s soft, slimy tongue and are covered by saliva. The smell of raw fish overpowers you, as you begin to panic and try to move towards the front of the otter’s mouth in a desperate effort to escape. However, the soft and slippery surface of the tongue makes it impossible, and you almost slip towards the otter’s throat. The otter moves you around on its tongue, considering your taste as it is unfamiliar with the taste of human flesh. The otter finds you delicious, and after a few minutes of savouring your taste, it lifts up its tongue, forcing you to slide down towards its throat. You struggle as you are pulled down the oesophagus until you are eventually deposited in the stomach. The stench of rotting fish is worse in here than in the mouth, making you almost vomit. You start to panic as acids seep into the stomach, ready to digest you. You punch on the walls of the stomach, trying to get the otter to vomit, although your efforts are in vain, as your small size renders the punches useless. You feel your feet burning as the acids burn through your shoes and then start work on your skin. You fall down into the stomach acids and are slowly digested. Meanwhile, the otter, travels back towards its den where it rests for a short time while its meal is digested.
1112222.title: Otter Food

112.content:
You find yourself at a wee one inch. Not too bad, but you still needed to be careful. Now only one thing left to do.

Were the heck do you go?
112.title: about 1 inch

1123.content:
You deside to look inside that old barn. After all, it had everything you needed. Shelter, a place to store food, the works.

You trek over and place your miger belongings on the ground, before laying down on the soft hay. For a while, you just lay there, pondering how this happened. Then you hear a noise behind a tractor tire. You wander over and spot a...
1123.title: That old barn

choices: Try to make your way to the shack.
113.content:
You blink a couple of times and pinch yourself but it is of no use: You are not dreaming. As you stand up again, you realize just how small you are now...
The leafs on the ground around you are gigantic and the grassblades seem as high to you as a tree to a normal sized man. Your size can at most be one centimeter, maybe it's even less.
Well, all in all your situation seems to be quite.... difficult. You are one centimeter tall, you are lost in a forest, you don't know where and probably nobody else does. At your size, trying to walk through the forest in search for help would be kind of useless... your only hope is that sooner or later someone will miss you and send out helpers to look for you. Maybe you should try to get somewhere where you can be spotted more easily
North of you, you spot a small hill. This might be a good place to go and although this will be a long way for someone at your size, you are sure that you could make it somehow.
You could also try to go into the other direction where you see a small old shack in the forest. It's unlikely that someone lives there but it is not that far away.
113.title: Too small for this world....?

choices: Keep moving... it's just a rabbit
1131.content:
To reach the hill, you will have to cross a small meadow first.
However, this is not as easy as it sounds. It is hard enough for you to get out of the forest. Luckily, you make it without any incident but then you stand directly at the edge of the meadow which now seems like some weird kind of jungle to you with all its big plants, grassblades and things like that.
You find it hard to tell its exact size but you guess that it is roughly twenty or thirty meters of high-grass covered area that seperates you from the hill. It sure is risky to take this path but walking around would probably cost you way too much time so you brace yourself and get ready to move.

Just as you take your first step, you notice a movement to your left. You turn your head and see a big brown rabbit with long upright ears. It looks at you with curiosity.
You are a little bit curious aswell and ask yourself how this - in your eyes harmless - animal could react to you...
1131.title: Face the jungle

choices: Thinks *this human will look great as fat on my buns
11312.content:
You carefully approach the rabbit, making no sudden movements. The rabbit has the same idea, and moves closer. You extend your hand so the rodent could get a smell of you.

The animal jerks up, looking for danger. You look around as well, and spot a fox a bit away, but nothing major.

You look back at the rabbit, which is sniffing your hand. The mammal then licks your hand, than looks you in the eye, then...
11312.title: Carefully approach the wild rabbit...

113121.content: The ground shakes and the rabbit runs off. A giant deer emerges from the tree like
113121.title: It turns to leave

113122.content:
The rabbit licking her lips was your only warning before she opens her maw wide and shoves you in. She purrs at the sensation of you squirming in her maw. Without warning, the rabbit's tongue started shoving you about and wrapping around your form, taking in your taste.

Just as if it couldn't get any worse, her tongue shoved you to the back of her throat. Knowing what was coming, you thrash about even more, earning a happy purr from your captor. With a GLURK, you were squeezed into her gullet. You squirm in disgust as the wet walls of flesh surrounding you.

With a splash, you land in her stomach. You instantly get up and pound at the walls, trying to make her let you go, but to no avail. Your world lurched when she sits on her hunches. A moment later, you are sandwiched between two walls of flesh as she pushes her belly with her front paws, before letting go.

Finding herself out in the open, she hopped back to her burrow, bouncing you around. You were too disoriented to do anything as you were tossed about like a washing machine. Laying down, she drifted off to dreamland, while you were polished off.

A while later, the rabbit woke up, glancing at her ass-cheeks, which were twin, furry melons, the only sign that she had eaten a human
113122.title: Thinks *this human will look great as fat on my...

choices: Face it and try to present yourself as the human you are!
1132.content:
You decide to stay in the forest and head for the small shack. This way is a little bit shorter but also more difficult and probably dangerous. Behind the trees, you see the sun going down slowly so you won't have much time before it gets dark.
Another factor that you'll have to consider is the presence of the wild animals who live in the forest. You are not an expert so you can't tell what kinds of animals are around and how you should behave to avoid them.
With these thoughts on your mind, you set out for the shack, trying to find an easy way through all the leafs, branches, stones and acorns that lie on the ground.

You encounter the first wild animal earlier than you expected: beneath a bush not far away from you, there is a small rodent. It has brown and white fur and a long bushy tail... a squirrel. Well, at least it should be small but at your size it seems really huge due to the fact that it is roughly eight or ten times your size.

The squirrel watches you as you walk by... it surely finds you interesting. You avoid looking back but you notice that it approaches you a little bit.

How should you react?
1132.title: First encounter - cute or dangerous?

11321.content:
You realize that facing that squirrel would be suicide for someone as small as you! You keep moving, but as soon as a something (a bush, in this case) gets between the line of sight of you and the squirrel, you dive into it and stay as still as you can.

         The rodent comes closer and sniffs the bush. It seems to be puzzled by the plant and your unexplained disappearance, but then it seems to notice you, because it looks straight at you!

         Just as it reaches out at you, it gets tackled by a huge, brown fox. The squirrel manages to break free, runs past it, and sprints away. The fox gives chase, leaving you alone in the bush. Whoa! What a close call!

         You sit in the bush, tired and breathless. You are so tired due to the encounter, and it is so late, that you consider the possibility of sleeping in the bush. However, the shack isn't too far away from the bush, and it is probably safer there than here. What do do?
11321.title: In Hiding

113211.content:
Okay, you think, I have to get to that shack. You cautiously walk out of the bush, and begin to head for the shack. It still is tough going, with all the sticks and leaves, but you still keep on heading towards the shack. After about 15 minutes of walking, you are nearly there.

         You think to yourself, Okay, this isn't as hard as I thought! If I keep going like this, I should be there in- wait, why is the forest suddenly quiet? What is tha- OH SHIT RUN!

          As you think that last thought, you notice a shape running towards you! You break out into a run, but it is still gaining on you! Blades of grass whir by as you sprint past. It seems like an eternity, running at top speed from a creature of the night. You approach the shack, and you see a hole by the door that looks big enough for you to fit through! You leap forward, and dive into the hole, expecting at any moment to be your last!

         The moment never comes, and you land inside the shack, out of reach of the night-creature, and most importantly, still in one piece.
113211.title: A short journey

choices: a rat (that for you looks huge)
1132111.content: The experience of almost being caught is too much for you to calm down and rest so you decide to explore the shack. you are really small so it will take a long time but its better than doing nothing. you wander for a bit with nothing happening. then you notice something moving. you move closer and it was a...
1132111.title: Explore the shack

choices: Attempt to flee from the enormous rodent.
Submit to the giant rat, and allow yourself to be devoured.
11321112.content:
As you approach the mysterious creature, you discover it to be a mangy, black-furred rat. A rather large rat.

Sucking in a breath, you steadily back away from the ebony mass of tattered fur and dirt. You knew rats were quite the predator, and did not wish to feel your soft and tender flesh punctured by its powerful incisors.

However, it seems the rat has picked up your scent, as it turns around to face you, rearing up on its hind legs to demonstrate both its massive height and girth compared to you. You also notice a glint of hunger in its red eyes, a glint that seems particularly focused upon your tiny body...
11321112.title: The Giant Black Rat

choices: The rat decides you look tasty!
The rat decides to leave you alone
113211121.content:
You consider just standing there and letting it do what it wants with you. But you decide against it. You may be tiny, but you're not going to just give up and let this rat have you!

You turn and run, heading for the closest thing to hide behind. But you haven't gone far at all when you feel a sudden tightness close around your body from the shoulders down. You glance down and see that the rat has clamped its front paws around your body, and you gasp as you're quickly plucked off the ground!

The rat lifts you up, but lets go and throws you over it. You land hard, and try to get up, but stop as the rat walks over to you and stares down at you. You look up at its small red eyes, and realize that you can't simply run away from it. You sit there considering what to do next.... But the rat akready has decided what to do with you....
113211121.title: Attempt to flee from the enormous rodent.

1132111211.content:
The rat licked her lips, deciding that your only good as rat fat. Before you could do anything, the rodent stuffs you into her foul smelling maw, which snapped shut behind you, sealing your fate. The rat's tongue tossed your tender body about, pinning you to the cheeks and roof, sucking on you like a piece of candy.

The rat squeaked with delight at the feeling of you wriggling in her maw. now for the fun part.

Tilting her head back, she swallowed, sending you to her stomach. As the acids rose, you punched and kicked her stomach wall before slipping and falling with a splash in the acids. Outside the rat sat on her hunches and rubbed her belly, her round ears twitching, picking up the sounds of you gurgling. A few moments, the rat fell back on all fours, having digested her latest meal. Before she scampered off, she gave her rear-notability bigger from your tasty form-a pat. Then, she was off.
1132111211.title: The rat decides you look tasty!

1132111212.content:
The rat, after staring you down for a bit, finally lets out a quiet squeak and turns around, walking off. You breathe a sigh of relief. Looks like the rat, for whatever reason, didn't feel like eating you. You get up and hurry in the opposite direction of the rat, making it to the hole by the door through which you came in.

Now, you pause and consider your next move. You could leave the shack and brave the outdoors again, or you could stay inside. That would be risky due to the presence of the rat, but it spared you once and it might do it again. And it might be safer in here than outdoors.

After some thought, you decide to...
1132111212.title: The rat decides to leave you alone

choices: You Fall Off and Land on a Something
11321112121.content:
You decide that you're less than 1/2 an inch tall and where there's one rat there's bound to be more. Just because one of those rats spared you doesn't mean that you'll get lucky next time, so you decide that it's best to split while you can and run out the back door of the shack, through large blades of grass as big as trees. In the process, you absentmindedly begin to climb up one of those trees through the root. Once you realize what you've done, you gasp. But then you stop yourself and realize this might work to your advantage. The higher you are, the safer you are, right?

You shrug your shoulders and begin to climb up the tree as fast as your tiny self can go. Of course, as you're busy climbing up, you fail to realize that you're not even halfway up the tree. In fact, because of how small you are, it takes you two hours just to get to the lowest branch. It is at this moment you climb a branch and then you stop and start to catch your breath. You watch animals as big as buses move about on the ground and then you shiver. You realize that you're safer in the trees. As you're in the tree looking around, you hear strange sounds, like some sort of bird.

You shiver again. You were so busy avoiding the predators on the ground, you didn't even consider the possibility of predators in the trees. In a panic you rush and try to climb to the top of the tree. It is at that moment...
11321112121.title: Out of the Shack and Into the Fire

choices: You go to the rat hole.
11321112122.content: You decide that it is much safer in the shack that only have small critters in it than outside where there are massive monsters. You take a deep breath and turn away and start to explore the shack some more. As you are walking, you are half tempted to check out the rat’s lair. It didn’t eat you the first time. It might keep you safe. At least safer than I’d be out in the open.
11321112122.title: Stay in the shack

choices: Was very pissed, and grabbed you with her tail
Dosen't mind at all, and leaves you be.
113211121221.content:
Seeing how it's the only form of cover, you venture into the rats home. It was dusty, causing you to sneeze more than once. Due to the darkness, you used a pen light to help find your way.The sound of claws scratching the floor caused you to look up, spotting the tail of a red squirrel whisking away.

You continue onward, spotting a little brown bat flitting into the dark. You had a feeling they were curious of you, but didn't want to be spotted.

A scratching sound behind you drew your attention. You turned and say the fat looking at you, no doubt wondering what you were doing here. Then she...
113211121221.title: You go to the rat hole.

1132111212211.content:
The rat hissed and stood on her hunches, clearly pissed at you for invading her home. You back up slowly, more than willing to leave. But fate had other plans. The Rat's long tail wraps around your leg, and yanked you off your feet. You find yourself dangling in front of her muzzle.

A low growl rumbled from her throat as she glared at you. Then she lifted you even higher, holding you directly above her head. Fear grabbed you when she opened her muzzle. Fate's plans were for you to be rat fat.

The tail let go, and you plummeted into her maw, which snapped shut behind you. Her tongue roughly shoved you about, taking your marvelous taste. She shoved you between her teeth and chewed lightly. You could only cry out as your clothing-minus your underwear-were shredded.

Finally, she swallowed, sending you to her stomach. You splash in the acids, which quickly begin to tingle. The rat licked her lips and rubbed her belly. The more the meal in there gurgled, the bigger her cheeks grew. With one last gurgle, you were goe. The rat smirked and ran a paw over her ass, happy with the results
1132111212211.title: Was very pissed, and grabbed you with her tail

1132111212212.content:
The rat isn't really bothered by your presence, and leaves. You breath a sigh of relief, and continue on your way.

You find a spot to settle down for the night. Using old clothes and stuffing for your bed. With that out of the way, you look for food.

You had seen a nest from a wood pidgeon, and decided that dinner would be eggs. You venture forth, spotting an egg laying on the nest, most likely pushed out by a cuckoo chick.

You roll the egg back to your camp-killing a cricket for extra protien-and build a fire to cook the egg. Just as you were about to tuck into your feast, the scrabble of claws drew your attention to the dark. Warily approaching you was the...
1132111212212.title: Dosen't mind at all, and leaves you be.

11321112122121.content:
It was the Red Squirrel. She scampered towards you, her natural fear of fire overwhelmed by her curiosity of the tiny human and the smell of the cooked egg. You decide to make friends with her, and offer her some of the egg.

She warily moves forward, and grabs a paw-full of egg, tasting it. Her hazel eyes widened at the taste, and she chattered happily. Together you tucked in.

After your meal, she scooped you up with her tail and nuzzled you, then gave you a lick...
11321112122121.title: Red squirrel

choices: start to gurgle you into Squirrel ass
113211121221211.content: The Squirrel licked her lips, knowing what she was having for dessert. You gasp as she shoves you in her gob, purring at your taste and struggles. Finally she swallows, purring at the sensation of a living meal sliding to her stomach. You land with a splash, where her acids
113211121221211.title: she likes your taste

113211122.content:
You know your chances of survival are slim at this size. So you figure you might as well die by feeding an animal, and what better animal than the rat that is considering you for its next meal. So you don't do anything as the rat lunges forward and grabs you in its front paws. You squeeze your eyes shut tight and prepare to be devoured as the rat brings you up to its mouth.

The rat wastes no time stuffing you into its hungry maw. You quickly find yourself lying on its tongue. Saliva starts to cover you from head to toe as the rat's foul smelling breath washes over you. Then it starts licking you against the roof of its move and rolling you around on its tongue as conisders how you taste. The rat discovers that you're delicious and continues to savor you for several minutes. Eventually, the tongue settles down and you squeeze your eyes shut again as it starts to push you towards the back of the throat. Then the rat tilts its head back and swallows you whole with a loud gulp. You slowly travel down the esophagus. It's almost like a slimy waterslide as you become covered in mucus and even more saliva as the muscles massage you down to the stomach. Eventually, your journey comes to an end as you land in the stomach with a plop. It isn't long before the digestive jucies begin to flow. You cry out in pain as they slowly start to digest you. Fortunately, you pass out from the pain long before you're completely digested. At least you did something good for the rat by allowing yourself to become the best rat food it will ever have.
113211122.title: Rat Food

11322.content:
"Well, it's just a squirrel... how dangerous can it be?" you think and turn around. You look right into the squirrels eyes which is now sitting on its hindpaws just three meters away from you with its eyes fixed on you and its tail twitching.
You try your best to sound as frightening as possible while you shout at the rodent "Ssshhh! Go away! Go and find yourself some nuts!".
The squirrel just cocks its head while your overconfidence slowly fades away. You stop shouting and back off a few steps.

You suddenly remember a documentary about squirrels and several other animals which you once saw on TV. It was said that besides plants and nuts, squirrels also eat insects and even prey on smaller animals from time to time.
You somehow don't like the idea of being caught by a squirrel, so you decide to run away but of course, the squirrel is much faster than you are. It catches up with you with only 2 jumps, pins you down with one of its paws and carefully sniffs at you. It then sits back on its hindpaws again and uses both paws to grab you and lift you up.
Now finding yourself being held right in front of the squirrels mouth, you realize that you really are in big trouble.
Yout start kicking and try to hit the squirrels nose but before you achieve anything with that, the squirrel comes to the decision that you might indeed taste good. It opens its mouth and quickly stuffs you in.
Luckily, it does not use its strong and sharp teeth to chew on you. It seems more interested in tasting you and savouring your flavor. You really can not figure out what it is on your body that the squirrel likes so much.
After some time, you feel a slight lurch as the squirrel lifts its head and then, with you still squirming around in its mouth, it takes a big gulp to swallow you whole.

This must look really funny, you think.... a squirrel catching and gobbling down a tiny human. Well, apparently it is not that funny when you are the human in that case.
You are squeezed into the rodents stomach and feel every movement around you as the squirrel runs off and climbs on a tree. However, this does not last for long. The squirrel finally reaches the tree with its nest where it settles down and while you slowly fall asleep, you still can not belief that of all possible threats in this world, it is a squirrel that now finishes you.
But of course, it does not help and there is nothing you can do. The squirrel completely digests you before it leaves its tree again to look for some nuts or whatever else may cross its way.
11322.title: Going nuts?

12.content:
The place you were at was quiet and serene.The smell of cow manure and the dew from the grass filled your nostrils.
You sit back up and take in the view.
A beautiful,wide open plain with a house and a few places where you assumed they kept the animals.
You then take a look at the sky.
Gray clouds covered up the blue.It looked like it was about to rain.
This place was absolutely humongous and beautiful,but that didn't matter.
What mattered was was that you got help as soon as possible,which would take a lot of walking just to get to the house which hopefully had people in it.
You stand up and dust yourself off.
Looking around,you were in the fields of this rural location and right along the fence line.
Of course it would be shorter to cut through the field to get to the house than following the fence posts.
But then you thought of the large animals that infested the fields.
Gigantic cows,horses,maybe even wild animals!
You thought for a second and decided to...

1:Cut through the field:you take the shorter path realizing the dangers of encountering an animal

2:Walk along the fence post:You follow the fences,it's the much longer route,but the chances of you encountering an animal is unlikely
12.title: in a rural area, close to a farm

121.content:
You decide to cut through the field,pushing blades of grass out of the way as you moved on.
The sky let out a loud crack alerting you of lightning but you weren't worried about being struck at your height.
As you continued to push down the grass it seemed to get thicker and thicker.
It got to the point where it was too thick to push down,leaving you in the middle of the field.
You had to find a way to get through the rest of this field.
Pondering what to do,you heard a loud rustle in the grass behind you.
You turn around quickly to see a towering rat.
It's eyes pierced through you like a blade.
The rat got on all two's and became twice as big as it was before,but now showing off her junk.
Not thinking about what to do more than once,you booked it through the thick grass like it was made out of paper.
You continued to run and looked back to make sure she wasn't following you,which wasn't the best idea.
The next leap you took caused you to faceplant into something that wasn't the ground.
You landed face first in a pile of wet manure!
The smell was intense and you were engulfed in it.
You left your head and spit out the poop that managed to get in your mouth.
Looking up,you see the large pile belonged to a...
121.title: 1:Cut through the field

1211.content: Towering over you is the massive backside of a cow. Flies swarm around you as you try to get out of the manure you had carelessly leapt into. All around you you see cows grazing happily, unaware of the human close by to them. It was a full herd and you were caught right in the middle of it. The question remains, how are you going to get out of this in one piece? Not that you expected cows to be extremely dangerous, but at your size one of the brutes could accidentally step on you. You could try walking through the heard or standby and wait for the cows to move on? Both choices have their own risk.
1211.title: Moo

12111.content:
You see that the clouds were getting darker since you've arrived and getting stuck in a storm at this height was not an option,as you could easily drown.
You start to look for a shelter and see that the farm owners' house was the closest to you.
Moving through the cow field was your quickest option of getting to the house before it rained,and it is likely there'd be more humans there.
You then pull yourself out of the slushy faeces and start your walk.
The cows were scattered all over the place and unexpectedly moved their hooves at random moments
This caused you to be completely focused on every step you took.
You were quickly but carefully navigating through all the cow pies and towering bovine.
Making great progress,you suddenly feel a drop of water on your head.
Looking up,you see it was starting to rain and within a few seconds you were being pelted with car sized water droplets.
You were now forced to find a make-shift shelter!
Quickly,you hide under a...
12111.title: When it rains...

12112.content: Deciding it is best to wait for the cows to move on, you sit down in the grass and hope for the best. You watch the cows hungrily consume the thick vegetation, grinding it to a paste with their powerful molars before swallowing and sending it into their guts. The lazy munching of the giant bovines makes you drowsy and keeping your eyes open becomes ever more difficult. The cows are obviously taking their time and a nap is not the worst idea, but sleeping in the open like this is not without risk.
12112.title: In The Sun

121121.content:
Fighting against sleep is futile and you eventually drift off into dream. By the time you wake up the sun has long set and you find yourself unable to see much. The cows have dispersed and in the distance there is the dim light of the farmhouse so you decide to head out. You do not get far when tremors in the ground bring you to a halt and a large shadow looms over you. Looking up you find yourself being observed by a lone cow who just happened to notice you. It moos at you, but when you give no response it lowers its muzzle to your height for a curious sniff. You, not wanting any trouble, simply turn and walk away, but you do not get far. A blast of hot air hits your back as the cow's tongue shoots out of its mouth, slips between your legs and curves upwards. A strong pull and you find yourself in the humid darkness of the bovine maw. Then the cow sucks on you greedily before flicking you into her gullet.

***GULP***

The cow stands still for a moment, enjoying the feel of you wiggling down her throat. Then she goes to join the herd with you inside her belly, never to be seen again.
121121.title: Grazed Upon

1212.content: You look up from the pile of manure you found yourself in and discover to be under the backside of a black horse. Its tail swishes back and forth swatting flys from its magnificent body. On the other side you see the massive head lowered down to the ground, powerful jaws munching on fresh grass. The great hoofs of the beast send tremors through the earth as it slowly hovered over the vegetation. Getting between those hoofs carried great risk yet a look into the blue sky revealed the distant form of a hawk eyeing for a careless morsel. Moving away from the horse and into the open was no less comforting.
1212.title: Equinus

12121.content: You deemed it safer to use the horse as cover from the preying hawk. Quickly, but silently you scramble through jungle which only moments before would have been no hindrance. Fortunately, the horse has already grazed here meaning that getting chewed up by its terrifying mandibles was less of a risk. Nonetheless, the rumbling hoofs are a constant fear as you do not wish to get ground to paste either. As such, you position yourself as centre of the monstrous herbivore as possible where you are the furthest from the great hoofs. From here you could see the hawk circle in great arches. You thank yourself for making the right choice when the hawk suddenly dives to the ground and rises with something caught in its claw. With the hawk gone making crossing the field much safer, you sigh in relief and get up to head out. Just then the horse happens to swing its head over its shoulder to scratch its chest when it notices you. It panics and backs up almost crushing you in the process. It turns to gallop away when its eyes meet yours.
12121.title: Taking Cover

121212.content:
When the horse looks at you it realizes that you are nothing to be afraid of. Its nerves calm and it turns to face you again. For a moment the two of you simply stare at each other. Finally, the horse's curiosity gets the better of it and it approaches you with its head lowered. The immense muzzle presses right against you and a flow of cool air almost sucks you into one of its nostrils as it attempts to identify what you are. Next a gust of warm breath washes over you as the equine satisfactorily stamps you as human. Still, what confuses it is your size. The humans it is used to were much bigger.

With one hand you touch the great muzzle of the beast and stroke it. The horse responds by slightly pushing you with its leathery lips. Then it parts its jaws and attempts to give your arm a small nibble, but at your size it feels as if your arm was bitten off. You try to slap the horse back, but to it your hit resembles nothing more than when a fly lands on its body. Quite contrastingly, it thinks you want to play and further pushes you around with its lips. You decide it best to play along since having a friend, human or not is never a bad idea in difficult times. This horse-play continues until finally, the equine slips out its tongue and gives your entire body a wet lick.

There is a silent pause; you shocked at suddenly being covered in horse drool and it surprised at your taste. The horse had always liked the taste of human. With the little hair the creatures possessed, it was easy to taste the salty flavour upon their skin. But even then, it was pretty much only arms the horse ever got to taste. This tiny human was - tiny. All the things the horse could do...

You are met by another much more passionate lick. A third one topples you over, but the tongue grants you no respite and continues to smother your body only to retract back into the maw to gather another batch of warm saliva. The horse does nothing to hide its pleasure and obviously does not doubt whether you are enjoying it which, despite it being utterly disgusting, you had to admit you are.

Suddenly, the horse stops its full massage and parts its jaws to show off the inside of its mouth. The request is obvious. It wants you to climb in. At this point you believe it safest to just walk away. But the treatment the horse was providing you was quite nice. Surely you are not that crazy?
121212.title: New Friend

1212121.content:
Curiosity gets the better of you so you make your way to the horse's mouth. The inside is absolutely disgusting, but something about the warm air flowing out of the depths attracts you. Your new friend whinnied a soft welcome as you grab on to the incisors and hurl yourself over the sharp teeth. The tongue immediately catches you and pulls you further in where you are sealed in darkness. You are tossed around, sucked upon and rubbed against the roof of the mouth. The horse is having its way with you and there was nothing to be done. After what feels like an eternity a sudden light emerges from one end of the cavern and you begin to slide towards it. Fresh air fills your lungs and you softly plop onto the grass. You had done well in trusting the horse, if getting a bit soaked in saliva did not matter.

Suddenly, a human voice is heard calling the horse. The two of you turn your heads in the direction of the voice and see the horse's owner approaching in the distance. This is your chance to get some help. Without thinking you leap onto your feet and start running towards potential rescue.

Your world is suddenly engulfed by a moist darkness. The familiar scent of the horse's breath becomes apparent. It had grabbed you by the waist and pulls you into its mouth. It was not going to let its owner take you away. No, it had other plans for you.

You go through another tongue bath until you are yet again spit out, this time into what is obviously a feeding trough. It is clear that the horse intends to keep you as its personal toy in its stable. For a while, the horse watches you contemplate your situation, but before long it falls asleep giving you your window of escape. With difficulty you clamber out of the trough which you find to be attached to the stall wall. Below is a steep fall, but the stable bedding has piled enough to secure a relatively soft landing. Alternatively, the wall which separated the next stall is sufficiently low to attempt a climb from the trough. Either way, you had to get away from this overly affectionate horse.
1212121.title: Climb in.

12121211.content: You decide to attempt the jump. It takes some time to build the courage, but you eventually just let go and dive. Fortunately, the bedding is enough to secure your impact and minor whiplash is the worst you suffer. Once you have yourself together you head under the black horse towards a gap between the stall wall. Getting there, you cross under and into the next stall which houses a goat. The goat immediately notices you and approaches which makes you uneasy. The urge to run back to the other stall burns inside of you when you notice your chance to escape under the stall gate. That is an attractive choice considering that going back means returning to the black horse. Yet, this goat looks very enthusiastic about you and the stall gate means you will have to run the gauntlet.
12121211.title: Risk the jump.

choices: The horse wants to show you around.
121212111.content: It is way to risky for your to try to get to the gate. It seems a lot safer to stay with the horse. It seems to want to keep you as a pet more than eat you and that might allow you to escape. Besides, the horse isn’t too bad. It’s actually quite nice and friendly and what’s better is that it’s big so I can keep you safe. You turn away from the goat and make your way back to the horse. You climb up on top of it and fall asleep in it’s mane. What happens the next morning?
121212111.title: Run back.

121212112.content:
You run at the goat. If you are going to get to the gate you must risk whatever the goat has in mind. At first, it backs off at your sudden attack, but as it realizes that you are about to escape it slams a cloven hoof in your path. You alter your direction and attempt to confuse it by running under its hairy body. The goat swings its head over its shoulders to find you, but you have already managed to dash for the gate. Only inches more and you would be safe.

Suddenly, a heavy object crushes you to the ground and forces all the air out of your lungs. The goat has caught you with its hoof and has a mischievous look in its eyes.
121212112.title: Run to the gate.

1212121121.content: You are not about to go without a fight. Struggling frantically, you attempt to free yourself from under the crushing hoof, but to no avail. The goat lowers its head and hovers its nose over your face. A blast of hot, musty breath washes over you as the goat opens it mouth and slips out its tongue. You can see the strands of saliva that stretch from top to bottom before your face is smothered by the greedy tongue. The goat, satisfied with your flavour, forks its antler under you and tosses your puny body in the air. Your momentary ascent ends with you plummeting head first into the open mouth of the goat. Its gullet is the last thing you see.
1212121121.title: Futile

12121212.content:
You decide to attempt the climb as it seemed safer than the jump. Of course, getting down from the stall's edge would still be a problem, but at least you could view your surroundings from above.

You manage to lift yourself onto the stall edge and find another stall inhabiting a quarter horse. It watches you balance yourself, but loses interest soon after. At the stall's end the wall protrudes slightly outwards which you can follow to reach an opened window or you could walk along the stall wall until you reach a more favourable place to descend. The window gave you the opportunity to get outside and after you experience with the black horse you grimaced at the thought of staying in the stables. Then again, outside you were vulnerable from every direction.
12121212.title: Attempt to climb.

121212122.content:
Though staying in the stables is not your ultimate desire, going outside does not encourage you either. Walking on the stall walls is relatively easy as the planks are wide and smooth. The quarter horse has its back to you and is completely oblivious to your movements. Below you is a large bucket filled with water which you could dive into, but the water is not high enough for you to reach the edge to climb out. Hence, you decide to continue on.

Away from your attention, a fly flies in through the window and lands on the quarter horse's backside. The horse lazily swishes its tail to swat it off, but catches you with some of its tail hairs. Your balance is lost and you stumble head first into the water bucket below. The water is cold causing your heart to miss a beat as you plop in. Desperately, you try to scramble out of the bucket, but the sides are too smooth and steep for that. There is nothing you can do as you attempt to stay afloat hoping that something might save you. Your prayers do not go unanswered.

The massive head of the quarter horse appears over the bucket and descends towards you. At first you think it would help you, but when it ignores you and sinks its nose into the water your true panic begins. The horse greedily sucks water into its mouth and the suction created by it pulls you in. Your attempts to swim against the current are futile and you are quickly slurped up. All orientation is lost as you are tossed around inside the mouth. The horse tastes you, but lazily assumes you are just a piece of scrap food. Without further delay it pushes the water to the back and swallows you down.
121212122.title: Watery Demise

1212122.content:
Climbing into the horses mouth is crazy so you decide to simply walk away before things get out of hand. Your new friend was not too happy with this choice and grabbed you by the collar bringing you to an abrupt halt. The horse flips you in the air and catches you on its soft tongue. You get the chance to see your surroundings; strings of saliva, the brownish molars and bits of food here and there. It was disgusting yet somehow comforting. Then the horse closes its jaws, sealing you in darkness.
